main event: A sighting of an unidentified flying object occurred at Dobbin Air Force Base in Marietta, Georgia on February 2, 1951.
interesting points: The object was reported to have a color of red-orange-reddish and white,The object was initially stationary and then moved at a high rate of speed before disappearing,Observations included a light that left a green, blue and white glow as it vanished,Radar attempts to track the object were unsuccessful as it was over four miles away from the radar station,Multiple airmen and operators were involved in the observation of the object.
witness description: airmen at Dobbin Air Force Base
